citeinfo.origin: NJ Office of Information Technology (NJOIT), Office of Geographic Information Systems (OGIS)
citeinfo.title: NJ TRANSIT Rail, Light Rail, and Subway Currently Operated Right-of-Way lines, with connecting PATH and PATCO Rail, 2016 (NAD83, NJSP feet)
citeinfo.edition: Based on NJ TRANSIT data release of 2016-01-09. No change to data definition from previous release; data records have been updated and expanded.

pubinfo.publish: NJ Office of Information Technology (NJOIT), Office of Geographic Information Systems (OGIS)

descript.abstract: Line data delineating right-of-way centerlines for rail, light rail, and subway service lines operated by NJ TRANSIT, and connecting commuter lines operated by Port Authority Trans Hudson (PATH) and Port Authority Transit Corporation (PATCO). Data set is in shapefile format (Esri).
descript.purpose: Provides location and attribute information for currently operated regional rail service. Data set is intended only for general planning and mapping use. Single lines represent approximate right-of-way centerlines, not track centerlines.
descript.supplinf:
This shapefile does not include linear referencing m values. Most of the lines were heads-up digitized from New Jersey 2007 High Resolution Orthophotography, which has a 1 foot pixel size and tested accuracy of +/- 4 feet. Some of the lines were derived from other sources. These data are re-published by NJ Office of Information Technology (NJOIT), Office of Geographic Information Systems (OGIS) under agreement with NJ TRANSIT - GIS-Transportation.
The SEPTA Trenton Line is included (it connects with NJ TRANSIT Northeast Corridor line), but SEPTA West Trenton Line is not.

idinfo.useconst: See conditions and disclaimers on NJ TRANSIT developer Web site. See Purpose, Data Quality, and Distribution sections in this metadata record for conditions that limit appropriate uses. Acknowledgement of the data set providers, NJ TRANSIT, GIS-Transportation and NJ Office of Information Technology (NJOIT), Office of Geographic Information Systems (OGIS), would be appreciated for maps, data or other products derived from this data set.
idinfo.datacred:
Source data in shapefile format are provided by Glenn D. Newman PLS, PP, Director of GIS-Transportation at NJ TRANSIT. Data are processed by NJ Office of Information Technology (NJOIT), Office of Geographic Information Systems (OGIS).
Service pattern information was retrieved from public Web sites, including maps, for NJ TRANSIT Newark Light Rail and Port Authority Trans Hudson (PATH) service.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.3.1.4959

attracc.attraccr: Status of attribute checks not provided.

dataqual.logic: The file contains duplicate lines on rights of way where more than one service operates. Topology has been checked for some lines, but error-free topology is not guaranteed. The ultimate source of line work varies by operator.
dataqual.complete: Includes only portions of track currently used by passenger rail service.

horizpa.horizpar: Rail line data for most of the lines were digitized from New Jersey 2007 HIgh Resolution Orthophotography, which has a tested accuracy of +/- 4 feet, NSSDA, and a one foot pixel size. Source of line data for subsurface lines (e.g. PATH, PATCO, Newark City subway) not provided to metadata author.

procstep.procdesc: PATCO line feature class was modified according to high-resolution ortho photo image, to improve alignments with tracks.

cntorgp.cntorg: NJ Office of Information Technology (NJOIT), Office of Geographic Information Systems (OGIS)

procstep.procdesc: Data sources were gathered for a new release of rail line data by OGIS. NJ TRANSIT GIS supplied shapefile of rail lines (included SEPTA Trenton Line, but not RiverLINE nor PATCO, and did not follow service pattern format). Several previous releases of rail data by OGIS (most recent release was missing some lines).

cntorgp.cntorg: NJ Office of Information Technology (NJOIT), Office of Geographic Information Systems (OGIS)

procstep.procdesc: Newark Light Rail and PATH lines were edited to reflect service patterns. Segments were duplicated, split, merged, and edited to correct topology problems.

cntorgp.cntorg: NJ Office of Information Technology (NJOIT), Office of Geographic Information Systems (OGIS)

procstep.procdesc:
Line work for a new publication of the NJ TRANSIT rail lines and connecting rail services was appended to a new shapefile from several sources: -NJ TRANSIT regional rail service lines were used from the release published by OGIS in 2015, after spot-checking locations against NJ TRANSIT February 2016 delivery. Glenn Newman had stated there were no changes to rail lines. -NJ TRANSIT RiverLINE and Hudson-Bergen Light Rail lines were used from the release published by OGIS in 2015. -NJ TRANSIT Newark Light Rail lines from the February delivery by NJT were edited to reflect two main service routes. -PATH lines from the June 2014 publication by OGIS were edited to create a record for each main service pattern. -PATCO line was copied from the OGIS 2015 release. -SEPTA line was copied from NJT February 2016 delivery.
The Princeton "Dinky" line was edited by OGIS to reflect changes apparent in 2015 orthoimagery.

cntorgp.cntorg: NJ Office of Information Technology (NJOIT), Office of Geographic Information Systems (OGIS)

mapproj.mapprojn: NAD 1983 StatePlane New Jersey FIPS 2900 Feet

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Rail service line or sub-line (branch) name, as known to public via NJ TRANSIT publications; or connecting service name.

edom.edomvd: Rail service line across S. New Jersey, between Philadelphia and Atlantic City
Service line between Hoboken, NJ and Suffern, NY, via East branch (Rutherford, Garfield, Plauderville, Fair Lawn, Glen Rock Boro Hall)
Hoboken via Secaucus to Meadowlands Sports Complex including MetLife Stadium
Service line between Hoboken, NJ and Suffern, NY, via West branch (Secaucus Junction, Kingland, Lyndhurst, Delawanna, Passaic, Clifton, Paterson, Hawthorne, Glen Rock-Main)
Service line from New York or Hoboken, to Hackettstown via Summit and Morristown, or to Gladstone via Summit
North-South line through central Hudson and Bergen counties
Light rail and subway line service in the Newark, Belleville, and Bloomfield
Service line from New York or Hoboken to Long Branch and Bay Head. Coincident with Northeast Corridor line until split after Rahway.
Service line from New York to Trenton. Separate branch service between Princeton Junction and Princeton.
Trans-Delaware line between Philadelphia and Lindenwold, NJ, aka Port Authority Transit Corporation, governed by Delaware River Port Authority
edom.edomvds: NJ TRANSIT Corporation and NJOIT, OGIS

edom.edomvd: Trans-Hudson line between Newark, NJ; Jersey City, NJ; Hoboken, NJ; and New York City. Aka Port Authority Trans Hudson, governed by Port Authority of New York and New Jersey (PANYNJ)
edom.edomvds: NJ TRANSIT Corporation and NJOIT, OGIS

edom.edomvd: Service lines from New York City to Port Jervis, NY, via either Clifton (Main Line) or Garfield (Bergen County Line.)
Service line New York City to High Bridge, NJ.
Light rail service from Camden, along Route 130 Corridor, and to Trenton

attr.attrdef: Specialized service of rail line, provided on particular trains

attrdomv.udom: Identifier for variant service (different service route and/or destination). Separate features are included for NJ Transit regional rail, Newark light rail, and PATH, but not for Hudson-Bergen light rail, RiverLINE, or SEPTA.

attr.attrdef: Date of last update or edit.

attrdomv.udom: Date field with dates in mM/dD/YYYY format

distinfo.distliab: See conditions and disclaimers on NJ Transit developer Web site.

stdorder.ordering:
In order to access GTFS data, you must sign up for an account on the NJ TRANSIT site for developers at https://www.njtransit.com/mt/mt_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=MTDevLoginTo
After login the page provides access to downloads of zipped GTFS data for rail and bus, including schedule information; instructions for the DepartureVision Web Service; RSS Feeds of Travel Advisories for Rail, Bus, Light Rail; and RSS Feed of Customer Notices for All Modes.

cntorgp.cntorg: NJ Office of Information Technology (NJOIT), Office of Geographic Information Systems (OGIS)

distinfo.techpreq: A desktop mapping client is required for use, such as ArcMap.
